Package com.github.tommyettinger.ds.support

@NotNullDefault package com.github.tommyettinger.ds.support
Code that isn't directly related to data structures, but supports their implementation.
Importantly, contains BitConversion, which allows certain bit-manipulation methods to work the same on GWT and other platforms. This also has EnhancedRandom and its primary implementation, LaserRandom, which together define and implement a superset of Random's API that can be used by various new classes.
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    com.github.tommyettinger.ds
    A large package of all data structures in this library, plus some interfaces they use.
    com.github.tommyettinger.ds.support.function
    Fills in code missing from the java.util.function package, mostly with primitive-specialized functions.
    com.github.tommyettinger.ds.support.sort
    Code for customized sorting on primitive arrays and collections.
    com.github.tommyettinger.ds.support.util
    Fills in code missing from the java.util package; this package is separate in an attempt to keep a clean break between the rest of the library and code based on OpenJDK's GPL v2 (with classpath exception)-licensed code.
    com.github.tommyettinger.ds.annotations
    This package just provides the NotNullDefault annotation, which uses javax.annotation to mark all fields, methods, and parameters as non-nullable by default.
  • Class
    Description
    Base
    Provides ways to encode digits in different base systems, or radixes, and decode numbers written in those bases.
    Base.IJoinedAppender<A>
    Primarily for internal use; this generalizes all the 1D appendJoined() methods for arrays (here, of numbers).
    Base.ISplitter<A>
    Primarily for internal use; this generalizes all the 1D typeSplit() methods that produce arrays of some primitive type (here, always numbers).
    BitConversion
    Methods for converting floats to and from ints, as well as doubles to and from longs and ints.
    DistinctRandom
    A variant on Java 8's SplittableRandom algorithm, removing the splittable quality so this has one possible stream.
    EnhancedRandom
    A superset of the functionality in Random, meant for random number generators that would be too bare-bones with just Random's methods.
    FourWheelRandom
    A random number generator that is extremely fast on Java 16, and has a very large probable period.
    LaserRandom
    A faster and much-higher-quality substitute for Random.
    StrangerRandom
    A random number generator that acts as a counterpart to FourWheelRandom by guaranteeing a slightly longer period and potentially being faster in some situations because it uses no multiplication.
    TricycleRandom
    An unusual RNG that's extremely fast on HotSpot JDK 16 and higher, and still fairly fast on earlier JDKs.
    Xoshiro256StarStarRandom
    A random number generator that is fairly fast and guarantees 4-dimensional equidistribution (with the exception of the quartet with four zeroes in a row, every quartet of long results is produced exactly once over the period).
